meanings.definition: To make gestures, especially while speaking.
meanings.sent1: She gestic wildly when telling stories.
meanings.sent2: He always gesticulates when he gets excited.
meanings.sent3: The comedian gesticulated so much that his hands were a blur.
meanings.sent4: Her hands gesticulated like dancers on a stage.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's gesticulations helped the students understand better.

meanings.definition: A gesture, especially a dramatic one.
meanings.sent1: His gestic caught everyone's attention in the play.
meanings.sent2: The politician's gestic was powerful and memorable.
meanings.sent3: The child's gestic of waving goodbye was adorable.
meanings.sent4: Her gestic of throwing her hands up in frustration was comical.
meanings.sent5: The actor's gestic conveyed more than words could express.
